body: the trailing slash is again likely to cause damage here, as in #7327

issue.title: Poetry environment broken after swapping package from PyPI release to git repo

repository.name: poetry
repository.description: Python packaging and dependency management made easy

issue.body:
<!--
    Hi there! Thank you for submitting a bug report!

    Before you submit your issue, please review and follow the instructions at
    https://python-poetry.org/docs/contributing/#reporting-bugs. Fully fill out the template below; insufficient
    information or bad reproduction instructions will impair the ability of others to help you.
-->

<!-- All the below information must be provided for others to understand and help with your issue. -->
- **Poetry version**: 1.3.1
- **Python version**: 3.7.3
- **OS version and name**: macOS 13.1
- **pyproject.toml**: https://gist.github.com/LK/3fcddd8f6cfe3ec00cfcc514e7700446

<!-- All the below steps should be completed before submitting your issue. Checked checkbox should look like this: [x] -->
- [x] I am on the [latest](https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry/releases/latest) stable Poetry version, installed using a recommended method.
- [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate.
- [x] I have consulted the [FAQ](https://python-poetry.org/docs/faq/) and [blog](https://python-poetry.org/blog/) for any relevant entries or release notes.
- [x] If an exception occurs when executing a command, I executed it again in debug mode (`-vvv` option) and have included the output below.

## Issue
<!-- Now feel free to write your issue, and please be as descriptive as possible! Make sure to include detailed reproduction steps. -->
<!-- Thanks again ðŸ™Œ â¤ -->
Repro steps:

1. `poetry lock`
2. `poetry install`
3. Swap the commented lines in the `pyproject.toml`, to point to the git repo instead of the PyPI release
4. `poetry lock`
5. `poetry install` or `poetry lock` fails with `No git repository was found at /Users/lennykhazan/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/api-server-apps-UDS0uKpv-py3.9/src/opencensus`.

The only way I've found to recover from this is to `poetry env remove --all` and then `poetry install` again, which seems to work.

<details>
<summary>Logs</summary>

```
â¯ poetry install -vvv
Loading configuration file /Users/lennykhazan/Library/Preferences/pypoetry/config.toml
Using virtualenv: /Users/lennykhazan/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/api-server-apps-UDS0uKpv-py3.9

  Stack trace:

  18  ~/Library/Application Support/pypoetry/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/cleo/application.py:327 in run
       325â”‚
       326â”‚             try:
     â†’ 327â”‚                 exit_code = self._run(io)
       328â”‚             except BrokenPipeError:
       329â”‚                 # If we are piped to another process, it may close early and send a

  17  ~/Library/Application Support/pypoetry/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/poetry/console/application.py:190 in _run
       188â”‚         self._load_plugins(io)
       189â”‚
     â†’ 190â”‚         exit_code: int = super()._run(io)
       191â”‚         return exit_code
       192â”‚

  16  ~/Library/Application Support/pypoetry/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/cleo/application.py:431 in _run
       429â”‚             io.input.interactive(interactive)
       430â”‚
     â†’ 431â”‚         exit_code = self._run_command(command, io)
       432â”‚         self._running_command = None
       433â”‚

  15  ~/Library/Application Support/pypoetry/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/cleo/application.py:473 in _run_command
       471â”‚
       472â”‚         if error is not None:
     â†’ 473â”‚             raise error
       474â”‚
       475â”‚         return terminate_event.exit_code

  14  ~/Library/Application Support/pypoetry/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/cleo/application.py:454 in _run_command
       452â”‚
       453â”‚         try:
     â†’ 454â”‚             self._event_dispatcher.dispatch(command_event, COMMAND)
       455â”‚
       456â”‚             if command_event.command_should_run():

  13  ~/Library/Application Support/pypoetry/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/cleo/events/event_dispatcher.py:26 in dispatch
        24â”‚
        25â”‚         if listeners:
     â†’  26â”‚             self._do_dispatch(listeners, event_name, event)
        27â”‚
        28â”‚         return event

  12  ~/Library/Application Support/pypoetry/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/cleo/events/event_dispatcher.py:89 in _do_dispatch
        87â”‚                 break
        88â”‚
     â†’  89â”‚             listener(event, event_name, self)
        90â”‚
        91â”‚     def _sort_listeners(self, event_name: str) -> None:

  11  ~/Library/Application Support/pypoetry/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/poetry/console/application.py:322 in configure_installer_for_event
       320â”‚             return
       321â”‚
     â†’ 322â”‚         cls.configure_installer_for_command(command, event.io)
       323â”‚
       324â”‚     @staticmethod

  10  ~/Library/Application Support/pypoetry/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/poetry/console/application.py:336 in configure_installer_for_command
       334â”‚             poetry.pool,

     â†’ 336â”‚             disable_cache=poetry.disable_cache,
       337â”‚         )
       338â”‚         installer.use_executor(poetry.config.get("experimental.new-installer", False))

   9  ~/Library/Application Support/pypoetry/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/poetry/installation/installer.py:78 in __init__
        76â”‚         self._installer = self._get_installer()

     â†’  78â”‚             installed = self._get_installed()
        79â”‚

       139â”‚                                 source_url,

     â†’ 141â”‚                             ) = cls.get_package_vcs_properties_from_path(src)
       142â”‚                             break
       143â”‚

   5  ~/Library/Application Support/pypoetry/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/poetry/repositories/installed_repository.py:89 in get_package_vcs_properties_from_path

        88â”‚
     â†’  89â”‚         info = Git.info(repo=src)
        90â”‚         return "git", info.origin, info.revision
        91â”‚

   4  ~/Library/Application Support/pypoetry/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/poetry/vcs/git/backend.py:174 in info

     â†’ 174â”‚         return GitRepoLocalInfo(repo=repo)
       175â”‚
       176â”‚     @staticmethod

   3  <string>:2 in __init__
         1â”‚

   2  ~/Library/Application Support/pypoetry/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/poetry/vcs/git/backend.py:144 in __post_init__
       142â”‚
       143â”‚     def __post_init__(self, repo: Repo | Path | str) -> None:
     â†’ 144â”‚         repo = Git.as_repo(repo=repo) if not isinstance(repo, Repo) else repo
       145â”‚         self.origin = Git.get_remote_url(repo=repo, remote="origin")
       146â”‚         self.revision = Git.get_revision(repo=repo)

   1  ~/Library/Application Support/pypoetry/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/poetry/vcs/git/backend.py:152 in as_repo
       150â”‚     @staticmethod

       153â”‚

  No git repository was found at /Users/lennykhazan/Library/Caches/pypoetry/virtualenvs/api-server-apps-UDS0uKpv-py3.9/src/opencensus

  at ~/Library/Application Support/pypoetry/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dulwich/repo.py:1127 in __init__
      1123â”‚                     and os.path.isdir(os.path.join(root, REFSDIR))):
      1124â”‚                 bare = True
      1125â”‚             else:

    â†’ 1127â”‚                     "No git repository was found at %(path)s" % dict(path=root)
      1128â”‚                 )

      1131â”‚         if bare is False:
```

</details>

rename.from: Poetry environment irrecoverably broken when installing multiple packages from git
rename.to: Poetry does not handle trailing slashes in Git urls

body:
copying this [comment from the other issue](https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry/issues/7327#issuecomment-1376224614) - I don't expect to do anything with this myself; but if anyone does care to take a look at it they might as well have this

> Ah, it's the trailing slash on git = "https://github.com/instabase/opencensus-python/" - that causes poetry's Git.cls.get_name_from_source_url to get the wrong answer, from which the rest follows.

Unable to reproduce this issue with latest Poetry version. Closing for now. If issue still exists, please comment with additional information. See logs below for successful install. ```sh podman run --rm -i --entrypoint bash python:3.12 < pyproject.toml < console.log

```console + python -m pip install --disable-pip-version-check -q poetry WARNING: Running pip as the 'root' user can result in broken permissions and conflicting behaviour with the system package manager. It is recommended to use a virtual environment instead: https://pip.pypa.io/warnings/venv + install -d foobar + pushd foobar /foobar / + cat + poetry install Creating virtualenv api-server-apps-lWDpn5M1-py3.12 in /root/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs Updating dependencies Resolving dependencies... Package operations: 21 installs, 0 updates, 0 removals - Installing pyasn1 (0.5.1) - Installing cachetools (5.3.3) - Installing certifi (2024.2.2) - Installing charset-normalizer (3.3.2) - Installing idna (3.6) - Installing protobuf (3.20.3) - Installing pyasn1-modules (0.3.0) - Installing rsa (4.9) - Installing urllib3 (2.2.1) - Installing google-auth (2.29.0) - Installing googleapis-common-protos (1.63.0) - Installing pycparser (2.21) - Installing requests (2.31.0) - Installing cffi (1.16.0) - Installing google-api-core (1.34.1) - Installing opencensus-context (0.2.dev0) - Installing cryptography (42.0.5) - Installing opencensus (0.8.dev0 ec72cd3) - Installing prometheus-client (0.20.0) Installing /root/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/api-server-apps-lWDpn5M1-py3.12/lib/python3.12/site-packages/opencensus/__init__.py over existing file Installing /root/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/api-server-apps-lWDpn5M1-py3.12/lib/python3.12/site-packages/opencensus/common/__init__.py over existing file - Installing opencensus-ext-prometheus (0.3.dev0 ec72cd3) - Installing pdfminer-six (20221210 47baa0d) Installing /root/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/api-server-apps-lWDpn5M1-py3.12/lib/python3.12/site-packages/opencensus/__init__.py over existing file Writing lock file Installing the current project: api-server-apps (0.1.0) Warning: The current project could not be installed: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/foobar/README.md' If you do not want to install the current project use --no-root. If you want to use Poetry only for dependency management but not for packaging, you can disable package mode by setting package-mode = false in your pyproject.toml file. In a future version of Poetry this warning will become an error! ```

the symptoms might have changed but `get_name_from_source_url()` is still broken for references that end in trailing slashes:
```
>>> from poetry.vcs.git.backend import Git
>>> Git.get_name_from_source_url("https://github.com/instabase/opencensus-python/")
''
```

eg after `poetry lock` on that `pyproject.toml` the git repository is wrongly cloned at the top-level `~/.virtualenvs/foo/src` and not as it should be at `~/.virtualenvs/foo/src/opencensus-python`.  (Though in this very particular case both are there, because of the second git dependency pointing at the same repo without the trailing slash)

probably wants re-opening, anyway something should track this

issue.title: handle trailing slash in git url

labels.description: Related to representing and locking dependencies
